rComments: His reading quizzes are open book and worth 20% which are easy 100%. His Midterm was literally the reading quizzes. So to get a 90+ on the midterm just memorize the reading quizzes. Same with the final except also memorize some important people and their contributions. Assignments are marked tougher so be prepared to spend time on them.
The final exam was not difficult and neither was the midterm as he takes questions from previous reading quizzes (multiple choice) but is terrible at responding to emails as he never checks his mail.

He is a very nice prof but not the most interesting. The lectures are quite boring and not necessary to watch - the textbook often explained things better. The exams are no longer open book, so there are hundreds of terms you have to memorize in order to do well.
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Get ready to read', 'Test heavy']

rComments: Made MDSA01 a bird by having all 3 exams open book, so easy 4.0 AS LONG AS YOU DO THE WEEKLY READING OF 30+ pages. There is one essay though which wasn't hard if you cited the textbook a lot. His lectures were quite boring as they were heavy with information and aren't really important. I still do not know what I learned tbh...

You could tell he was very passionate about what he taught and I truly loved his lectures. He made them exciting by always including examples from movies and shows. One warning is that the textbook is very dense, but you are expected to read all of it. All tests were open book so if you just read, you will do fine. Lectures and slides also help!

Hes amazing . Cares a lot about his students. go to office hours and have him read over essays and he will help you out. exams are all open book. don't really need to study for that. just read it over and then use the index to quickly find answers during exams. lectures aren't that boring since he shows relevent videos so we pay attention.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Literally my first time rating a prof, I came on this site just to rate him. Amazing class, I've really started to see more of media than I had before and its really changed my views. Prof Petit is also super caring and god bless his online exams. Yes you need to do your readings but you should be good since the exams are open book so just study.
very nice guy! Bring material to live. Lotsa reading, but that's ok.
He's the best professor I've ever seen . very kind person.

Amazing & sweetest prof. He will help you lot. Online midterm and tests. Don't cheat, & if you do, don't be a snake. It can be an easy A course, if you do all the readings & take notes & are aware of what you are doing in class. Better and easier if you work together as a group and create notes, since there's a lot of reading but honestly worth it

Midterms for this class have been online and open book for a while. That is no longer the case as of this semester. He changed this after the 'refund' drop deadline, after the first midterm. Not really respectful of the class to do so on such short notice - many people would not have taken the course if this was known in advance. Readings are LONG
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Having taken five courses with him over my academic career, I can say that Professor Petit is knowledgeable and passionate about the material he teaches. Lectures are quite engaging, and it is possible to do really well in his classes as long as keep up with the readings and are a strong writer.
teacherRatingTags: ['Respected', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I enjoyed Michaels class. Hes a very nice man, cares a lot, and is eager to help. However I feel as if his assignment instructions should be more clear. Other than that I enjoyed his class.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters']

rComments: He is a nice professor overall. If you approach him during his office hours, you would find out that he really cares about his students.
Great prof. He clearly knows what he's talking about. Biggest class evaarrrrr with an army of TAs, but who cares.

One of few Profs at UTSC that I'm actually rather unimpressed with. Very unorganized & never followed through with regrades as promised (due to TAs grading written exam answers inconsistently). Three exams were 85% MCQs & open book so easy marks overall. Prof has quite the liberal agenda & boasts about having tenure, quite obnoxious in my opinion.
The course started out well, relatively ok then he started making the exams harder and the short answer questions are marked really hard

This course is not well organized. Petit does not clearly articulate the material. He does not seem to enjoy what he is teaching. He is a very nice guy but not a great Prof. I would never suggest this class to anyone I like.

Best prof ever! Professor Petit is very knowledgable and passionate about media. Although there is a lot of content to read, his lectures really brought the book to life! Lectures were very interesting, and he adds his own spin with humour, anecdotes, and videos. He is  super clear, a fair marker, and willing to help.
Very friendly and understanding. Explains everything clearly with patience.
Nice guy. Good class. Assignments/essays and exams are fair and not hard. Good course! :)
He is a very very helpful and patient professor. Tests are textbook based. Assignments are fair and has wide opened of choices of topics. Overall, great learning experience
Love the course, not the prof. Always see other people's name on his lecture, very inconsiderate. Lecture slides are inconsistent, he may or may not post them.
prof. is enthusiastic in teaching, course contents are interesting. yet, markings are fairly tough.
Prof. is enthusiastic in teaching. Course materials are interesting. Yet marking of assignment is fairly tough.
Great prof, so helpful.  He works so hard to ensure that students do well.  Awesome guy.
Really great prof. Heavily reliant on the textbook for the midterm and final, and marked fairly on the assignments. Would definitely recommend his classes.

This was an easy class overall, it's heavily based on the textbook. The midterm and final was pretty much just to test your knowledge on the key terms in the textbook. Lectures are interesting and the professor is really nice.

Interesting, humorous, flexible (wide choice of project topics), speaks in a slow and clear manner, very helpful even for non-course related matters, and content is very easy. Definitely one of the best profs at UTSC.

MDSA01+ MDSA02+ HUMA01 + HUMA02. He is a great professor! He is very knowledgeable about the subjects at hand (humanities + media) and he is very fair in terms of exams and assignments. I would love to take his courses over and over again.

He is a fair and structured teacher. He will present information in a way that makes sense to you because humanities is a wide ranged area. Initially it may seem tough but if you keep at it, you will definitely improve!
one of the best professors i've ever had. I highly recommend people to take his courses. His teaching method is very interactive and interesting. None of his classes are boring!
